sentences.sContent: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.sCn: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

sentences.sContent: ...Purdue now has a pilot test to assess students’ critical thinking skills...
...They are a vital part of an array of data that we use to assess if we're doing well or doing badly...
...an admissions committee was content to ask for a sample of applicants' school papers to assess their writing ability...
...There is no easy way to measure racism directly; instead psychologists assess what is known as "implicit bias"...
...the participants had to declare their race and were told their results would be used to assess their strengths and weaknesses...
...In devising a way to assess hope scientifically...

remMethod.val: ass(驴子) ＋ ess → 给驴子(ass)估价(assess) → 估价

words.tran: 可估价的；可评价的；可征收的；可征税的
评审员；确定税款的人；顾问
财产价值已被估定之人

trans.tranCn: 对估价； 评价， 评论
trans.tranOther: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it
